title: Five years on, WHO urges China to share Covid origins data - Firstpost
​6 Very Beautiful Pictures Of Stars Taken By NASA Hubble Space Telescope​ - Times Now
summary:
6 Very Beautiful Pictures Of Stars Taken By NASA Hubble Space Telescope

Publication Date: Dec 31, 2024

Source: Times Now Digital

This article showcases six stunning images of stars captured by the NASA Hubble Space Telescope, highlighting the beauty and complexity of the cosmos.

  • Features images like the Rho Ophiuchi Cloud Complex, capturing the birth of stars.
  • Spotlights Omega Centauri, showcasing evidence of an intermediate mass black hole.
  • Includes images of stars like LAWD 37, which is a spent star.
  • Discusses the Stellar Cradle that shows both young stars and dusty lanes.
  • Highlights ESO 245-5, showcasing a galaxy close to the Milky Way.
  • Reveals the most distant star ever observed by Hubble.
"By making this observation, the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope has achieved a remarkable milestone: spotting the light from a star that formed within the initial billion years after the Universe's inception during the Big Bang."

This collection of images from the Hubble Space Telescope serves as a reminder of the vast beauty of the universe and the ongoing exploration of space.
newTitle: 6 Very Beautiful Pictures Of Stars Taken By NASA Hubble Space Telescope

SBI Life picks up 10% stake in Bima Sugam India Federation | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
SBI Life Acquires 10% Stake in Bima Sugam India Federation

Date: Not specified | Source: Live Mint

SBI Life has announced its decision to acquire a 10% stake in Bima Sugam India Federation for ₹6.6 crore, aiming to enhance the insurance product marketplace.

  • SBI Life's board approved an investment not exceeding 10% of Bima Sugam's paid-up equity share capital.
  • Bima Sugam India Federation is set to create a centralized marketplace for insurance products and services.
  • The company will invest ₹6.6 crore to purchase 66 lakh equity shares at a face value of ₹10 each.
newTitle: SBI Life Acquires 10% Stake in Bima Sugam India Federation

title: Taylor Swift taking big move as her ‘priorities’ shifted around Travis Kelce; ‘Nashville is the place where…’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Taylor Swift Moves to Nashville to Strengthen Bond with Travis Kelce

Publication Date: Dec 30, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Taylor Swift is relocating to Nashville, Tennessee, full-time to be closer to her boyfriend, Travis Kelce, reflecting a shift in her personal priorities.

  • The 35-year-old pop star is establishing roots in Nashville to strengthen her relationship with the NFL star.
  • Swift's decision marks a new outlook on life, moving away from her previous base in New York City.
  • Insiders report that her love for Kelce has profoundly shifted her priorities.
  • Nashville holds sentimental value for Swift, as it is where her career began.
  • She has attended numerous Chiefs games since they started dating in September.
“Taylor has grown up a lot in the past couple of years. Falling in love with Travis so deeply has shifted her priorities around a bit and has given her a new outlook on life.”

This move signifies a significant commitment in their relationship as they consider starting a family in the future.
newTitle: Taylor Swift Moves to Nashville to Strengthen Bond with Travis Kelce

title: 'Rupee 58.58 against Dollar in 2014, it's 85.27 now': Congress recalls PM Modi's 2013 remarks on deprecia - The Times of India
summary:
'Rupee 58.58 against Dollar in 2014, it's 85.27 now': Congress recalls PM Modi's 2013 remarks on depreciating currency during UPA government

Publication Date: [Date not provided] Source: [Source not provided]

In a recent statement, Congress leaders reflected on Prime Minister Modi's past criticisms regarding the depreciation of the rupee during the United Progressive Alliance (UPA) administration, citing the rupee's significant fall against the dollar from 58.58 in 2014 to 85.27 now.

  • Congress highlighted PM Modi's 2013 remarks condemning the UPA government for a depreciating currency.
  • The rupee's current value contrasted sharply with its value during the previous government tenure.
  • The depreciation raised questions about the current government's economic policies.
"The facts speak for themselves. The current exchange rate reflects the failures of the Modi government in managing our economy effectively."

This comparison emphasizes the changing economic landscape and invites discussions on policy efficacy over the years.
newTitle: 'Rupee 58.58 against Dollar in 2014, it's 85.27 now': Congress recalls PM Modi's 2013 remarks on depreciating currency during UPA government

title: Atishi defends Arvind Kejriwal calling her ‘temporary chief minister’, slams Delhi LG VK Saxena - Hindustan Times
summary:
Atishi defends Kejriwal's 'temporary CM' remark, criticizes Delhi LG VK Saxena

Date: Dec 30, 2024 10:33 PM IST
Source: Hindustan Times

Delhi Chief Minister Atishi defended Arvind Kejriwal after he referred to her as ‘temporary chief minister’ in response to criticisms from Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena.

  • Atishi extended New Year wishes to Saxena while addressing his concerns regarding Kejriwal's comment.
  • She emphasized that all elected officials are temporary and serve for the duration of their term.
  • Atishi criticized Saxena for focusing on criticism instead of cooperation.
  • She highlighted the importance of the Mahila Samman Yojana for women in Delhi and accused Saxena of politicizing his position.
  • Atishi stated that Saxena has failed at his responsibilities to keep Delhi safe.
“Governance should remain above petty politics, and I urge you to work alongside us in this spirit,” - Atishi

Atishi concluded by urging Saxena to discard political baggage and work towards citizens' welfare.
newTitle: Atishi defends Kejriwal's 'temporary CM' remark, criticizes Delhi LG VK Saxena

title: Pushpa 2 box office collection day 26: Allu Arjun film remains steady even after three weeks, crosses ₹1160 crore - Hindustan Times
summary:
Pushpa 2 Box Office Collection Day 26: Allu Arjun Film Remains Steady Even After Three Weeks, Crosses ₹1160 Crore

Date: Dec 30, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Pushpa 2, starring Allu Arjun, has continued to draw audiences even after three weeks of release, crossing ₹1160 crore at the box office.

  • The film collected approximately ₹6.65 crore on its fourth Monday.
  • Total box office collections stand at ₹1163.65 crore.
  • Week one gross was ₹725.8 crore, followed by ₹264.8 crore in week two and ₹129.5 crore in week three.
  • Despite controversies surrounding a tragic incident at a screening, the film maintained its audience appeal.
“We're extremely sorry for the family, and I will personally be there to support them in whatever way.” - Allu Arjun

The movie continues to have a significant impact at the box office, despite the challenges faced by its lead actor due to recent events.
newTitle: Pushpa 2 Box Office Collection Surpasses ₹1160 Crore

title: This chief minister, with a net worth of ₹15 lakh, is the ‘poorest’ in India, claims report - Hindustan Times
summary:
Mamata Banerjee Declared Poorest Chief Minister in India with ₹15 Lakh Net Worth

Date: Dec 30, 2024 | Source: HT News

The report by the Association for Democratic Reforms highlights that Mamata Banerjee is the chief minister with the lowest assets in India.

  • Mamata Banerjee's total assets are reported at ₹15,38,029, with no immovable assets.
  • Omar Abdullah ranks second, holding assets of ₹55,24,430.
  • Pinarayi Vijayan is third on the list, with total assets of ₹1.18 crore.
  • The report also discusses chief ministers with the most liabilities, including Pema Khandu and Siddaramaiah.
“Mamata Banerjee leads with the lowest assets worth ₹15,38,029.”

This report sheds light on the financial statuses of India's chief ministers and how they vary significantly.
newTitle: Mamata Banerjee Declared Poorest Chief Minister in India with ₹15 Lakh Net Worth

title: Isro launches space docking satellites, India on path to elite club; PSLV last stage has 24 payloads - The Times of India
summary:
Isro launches space docking satellites, India on path to elite club; PSLV last stage has 24 payloads

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

India's ISRO has successfully launched a mission involving space docking satellites, positioning the country closer to joining an elite group of nations capable of such advanced space operations.

  • The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) achieved this groundbreaking milestone through the PSLV, which managed to carry 24 payloads.
  • This launch signifies India's growing capabilities in space technology and exploration.
  • The successful docking could pave the way for future missions aimed at space stations and deeper space exploration.
'This launch is a testament to India's progress in the field of space technology.'

This achievement marks a significant step in India's ambitions in space exploration, showcasing advancements in satellite technology and positioning India prominently on the global space map.
newTitle: Isro launches space docking satellites, India on path to elite club; PSLV last stage has 24 payloads

title: "Third Umpire Should Have...": BCCI Top Official Breaks Silence As Yashasvi Jaiswal DRS Row Divides .. - NDTV Sports
summary:
"Third Umpire Should Have...": BCCI Top Official Breaks Silence As Yashasvi Jaiswal DRS Row Divides Cricket World

Publication Date: December 30, 2024   Source: NDTV

BCCI vice president Rajeev Shukla criticizes the third umpire's decision regarding Yashasvi Jaiswal's dismissal during the Boxing Day Test against Australia. The row highlights discrepancies in DRS technology usage.

  • Jaiswal was dismissed on a controversial decision while batting on 84.
  • Shukla stated Jaiswal was clearly not out and that the third umpire should rely on technology.
  • Sunil Gavaskar and other cricket officials criticized the decision.
  • The dismissal led to Australia's victory and a 2-1 series lead.
  • Former umpire Simon Taufel defended the third umpire's decision.
“Yashasvi Jaiswal was clearly not out. Third umpire should have taken note of what technology was suggesting.” — Rajeev Shukla

The incident has sparked significant debate about the reliability of DRS technology and its impact on match outcomes.
newTitle: "Third Umpire Should Have...": BCCI Top Official Breaks Silence As Yashasvi Jaiswal DRS Row Divides Cricket World

title: 10 micro-resolutions you can achieve in 10 minutes or less this New Year 2025 - The Times of India
summary:
10 Micro-Resolutions You Can Achieve in 10 Minutes or Less This New Year 2025

Publication Date: December 31, 2024 • Source: Times of India

As the New Year approaches, focusing on small, manageable changes can lead to more lasting results than traditional, grand resolutions. Here are ten micro-resolutions that can each be accomplished in ten minutes or less.

  • 10 Minutes of Walk

    Start your day with a brisk ten-minute walk to boost heart health and lifespan.

  • 9 Minutes of Reading

    Enhance memory and reduce stress through a quick reading session.

  • 8 Minutes of Preparing a Healthy Snack

    Start your day with a nutritious breakfast incorporating all food groups.

  • 7 Minutes of Stretching

    Relieve stress and prevent injury by taking a few minutes to stretch.

  • 6 Minutes of Journal Writing

    Enhance self-awareness and clarity by writing in a journal.

  • 5 Minutes of Meditation

    Boost focus and productivity through a short meditation session.

  • 4 Minutes of Planning

    Quickly plan your day to improve organization and clarity.

  • 3 Minutes of Decluttering Space

    Prepare for your workday with a tidy workspace.

  • 2 Minutes of Deep Breathing

    Calm your mind and reduce anxiety through deep breathing exercises.

  • Take a Minute to Drink a Glass of Water

    Stay hydrated to improve health and focus.
Each of these 10 goals requires no more than 10 minutes of your time and sets the stage for greater achievements in the New Year.

By adopting these micro-resolutions, you can make meaningful changes that promote wellness and prepare you for larger goals in 2025.
newTitle: 10 Micro-Resolutions for the New Year 2025

title: WhatsApp Web to get 'Reverse Image Search' feature to curb misinformation - CNBCTV18
summary:
WhatsApp Web to Introduce Reverse Image Search Feature to Combat Misinformation

Publication Date: March 2024
Source: CNBC TV18

WhatsApp Web is set to roll out a new feature that allows users to verify the authenticity of photos and combat misinformation directly through the app via Google.

  • The reverse image search feature enables users to upload images for verification.
  • This tool aims to combat misinformation by helping users identify manipulated or out-of-context images.
  • The feature will be accessible via the overflow menu in the image viewing interface.
  • WhatsApp will not access the images uploaded for verification.
“By integrating this feature, WhatsApp aims to empower users to make informed decisions about the content they share and receive...”

This initiative reflects WhatsApp's commitment to ensuring credible communication on its platform as it addresses the challenges posed by fake news and manipulated images.
newTitle: WhatsApp Web to Introduce Reverse Image Search Feature to Combat Misinformation

The US Appeals Court has upheld a significant verdict against Donald Trump in a sexual abuse case, affirming the jury's decision made earlier this year.

WhatsApp Integrates Google Reverse Image Search to Combat Misinformation - Mobile ID World
summary:
WhatsApp Integrates Google Reverse Image Search to Combat Misinformation

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Various sources

WhatsApp has added a new reverse image search capability to its messaging platform, enhancing its security tools. Users can now verify the authenticity of images directly within WhatsApp, using Google's image search technology.

  • Users tap an image and select “Search on the web” to verify authenticity.
  • The feature preserves user privacy by not storing uploaded images on WhatsApp servers.
  • This capability is currently in testing and aims to counter misinformation by identifying original sources of images.
  • It enhances existing security features and will be available for all users soon.
“The reverse image search capability enhances existing WhatsApp security features, providing users with integrated tools to assess the authenticity of received media.”

This new feature is a significant step towards combating misinformation and helping users make informed decisions about content sharing.
newTitle: WhatsApp Integrates Google Reverse Image Search to Combat Misinformation

title: 9 crucial nutrients for optimal gut health - The Times of India
'It Is Mentally Disturbing': Rohit Sharma Dejected After India's Poor Show In Melbourne - News18
summary:
India's Poor Show in Melbourne

Date & Source: Last Updated: December 30, 2024, 18:38 IST, News18

India's hopes of winning the Border-Gavaskar Trophy ended with a crushing defeat in the 4th Test against Australia in Melbourne. Chasing 340, India lost their top-three batsmen early, but Yashasvi Jaiswal and Rishabh Pant revived the innings. However, a batting collapse in the third session led to India's defeat by 184 runs.

India captain Rohit Sharma described the performance as "mentally disturbing" and "disappointing".

  1. India lost the Test series 2-1.
  2. Rohit Sharma expressed his disappointment and frustration.
  3. Batting collapse in the third session led to India's defeat.
  4. Jasprit Bumrah, Yashasvi Jaiswal, and Nitish Rana were the bright spots for India in the match.

"It is mentally disturbing when you can’t do what you have come to do... It is pretty disappointing. There are ways to win games and we fell short in finding ways to win the game here. We wanted to fight till the end and unfortunately, we couldn’t do it." - Rohit Sharma

Conclusion: India's defeat in Melbourne has left Rohit Sharma and the team dejected, with the captain expressing his frustration at their inability to win the game.
newTitle: Rohit Sharma's Disappointment After India's Defeat in Melbourne

title: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu richest Chief Minister, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee poorest: ADR - The Hindu
summary:
India's Chief Ministers: Wealth Gap and Criminal Cases

Date & Source: Published on December 30, 2024 08:39 pm IST, The Hindu

Andhra Pradesh CM N Chandrababu Naidu is the richest in India with assets worth over ₹931 crore, while West Bengal's Mamata Banerjee is the poorest with just ₹15 lakh, as per an ADR report.

  • Average asset per CM: ₹52.59 crore
  • Average self-income of a CM: ₹13,64,310 (7.3 times India's average per capita income)
  • Total assets of 31 CMs: ₹1,630 crores
  • 13 CMs (42%) have declared criminal cases
  • Only 2 CMs are women
Out of the 31 Chief Ministers, 10 (32%) have declared serious criminal cases.

Published on - December 30, 2024 08:39 pm IST
newTitle: India's Chief Ministers: Wealth Gap and Criminal Cases

title: Ravichandran Ashwin's 4-Word Tweet On Yashasvi Jaiswal's Controversial Dismissal Goes Viral - News18
summary:
Ashwin's Viral Tweet on Jaiswal's Controversial Dismissal

Date: December 30, 2024 Source: News18

Ravichandran Ashwin reacted to the controversial decision surrounding Yashasvi Jaiswal's dismissal during the India vs Australia Test match, posting a four-word tweet that went viral.

  • Jaiswal was given out by the third umpire without clear evidence from snicko.
  • Ashwin's response on social media gained significant traction.
  • Sunil Gavaskar criticized the third umpire's decision during commentary.
  • Indian fans expressed their displeasure, chanting “Cheating” in the stadium.
  • Jaiswal scored 84 runs in his innings and finished the year with 1478 Test runs.
Australian doing what they are known for Cheating!! As per ICC rules if Sniko shows no disturbance then it should be not out. Jaiswal was given out incorrectly. — Ctrl C Ctrl Memes (@Ctrlmemes_) December 30, 2024

Jaiswal's performance solidified his place among India's top run-scorers for the year, reflecting his growing prominence in international cricket.

title: Biden Administration Announces Additional Security Assistance for Ukraine - Department of Defense
summary:
Biden Administration Announces Additional Security Assistance for Ukraine

Date: Today | Source: U.S. Department of Defense

The Department of Defense announced a significant package of security assistance aimed at enhancing Ukraine's defenses amidst ongoing aggression from Russia. This includes two major initiatives, totaling approximately $2.47 billion.

  • Authorization of a $1.25 billion Presidential Drawdown Authority package for urgent military needs, including air defense, munitions, and anti-tank weapons.
  • An additional $1.22 billion through the Ukraine Security Assistance Initiative, focusing on advanced air defense and unmanned systems.

The assistance includes various munitions and systems to bolster Ukraine's military capabilities. This marks the Biden Administration's twenty-third USAI package and seventy-third tranche of equipment support since August 2021.

The U.S. continues to collaborate with around 50 Allies to ensure Ukraine has the necessary support to combat Russian aggression.
newTitle: Biden Administration Announces Additional Security Assistance for Ukraine

title: Apple TV+ will be completely free during the first weekend of 2025 - BGR
summary:
Apple TV+ Offers Free Weekend Access in January 2025

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Apple TV+ has announced that its streaming service will be completely free for all users from January 4 to January 5, 2025, marking the first time the platform offers full access without a subscription.

  • The offer is available on any device with the Apple TV app, including iPhones, iPads, Macs, and smart TVs.
  • This initiative aims to attract both new users and past subscribers who may have canceled their subscriptions.
  • Apple TV+ launched on November 1, 2019, and features a range of original shows, movies, and documentaries.
  • The service has garnered significant accolades, including 535 wins and 2,450 nominations in various awards.
  • Despite a recent price increase, Apple TV+ remains a competitive streaming option without ads.
  • Users can enhance their experience through the Apple One subscription, which includes additional services.
"Apple Original films, documentaries, and series have earned 535 wins and 2,450 award nominations and counting."

This limited-time offer provides a unique opportunity for viewers to explore Apple TV+'s content and could lead to an increase in long-term subscriptions following the free access period.
newTitle: Apple TV+ Offers Free Weekend Access in January 2025

title: ‘Objectionable’: Delhi LG on Arvind Kejriwal's ‘temporary CM’ remark on Atishi - Hindustan Times
summary:
Delhi LG Criticizes Kejriwal's 'Temporary CM' Remark on Atishi

Date: Dec 30, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Delhi's Lieutenant Governor Vinai Kumar Saxena has expressed his objection to Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal referring to Atishi as a 'temporary chief minister'. He stated that this language is offensive and misleading.

  • LG Saxena found Kejriwal's comments to be discriminatory against Atishi and the principles of the Indian Constitution.
  • Saxena emphasized the importance of respectful public discourse and criticized Kejriwal for undermining Atishi's position.
  • He pointed out that Kejriwal's long tenure as CM was marked by unaddressed issues like pollution and healthcare.
  • Saxena mentioned that Kejriwal's claims regarding Atishi involved unauthorized announcements and unfounded accusations.
“As a lieutenant governor, I am concerned about this level of public discourse and at the same time, I am hurt by the conversation of presenting the full-time chief minister of my government as a temporary chief minister.”

In conclusion, LG Saxena calls for higher standards of public discussion, especially among elected officials, to uphold the dignity of all public office holders.
newTitle: Delhi LG Criticizes Kejriwal's 'Temporary CM' Remark on Atishi

title: Pushpa-2 stampede case: Hyderabad court reserves Allu Arjun's bail order, hearing postponed to Jan 3 - Hindustan Times
summary:
Hyderabad Court Delays Bail Decision for Allu Arjun in Stampede Case

Date: December 30, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

A Hyderabad court has postponed its decision on the bail plea of actor Allu Arjun, who is implicated in the Sandhya Theatre stampede case that resulted in a woman's death and a child's injury. The verdict has been deferred to January 3, 2025.

  • The stampede occurred during the Pushpa-2 premiere on December 4.
  • Allu Arjun was arrested on December 13 and granted interim bail the following day.
  • The actor's plea for regular bail is being contested by the police.
  • A complaint was filed by the family of the deceased woman, leading to the legal action against Arjun and others.
  • The father of the injured child reported that his son is finally responding after 20 days.
“The child responded after 20 days. He is responding today. Allu Arjun and the Telangana government are supporting us.” - Bhaskar, father of the injured child

The case has sparked significant public interest, underscoring the repercussions of the tragic incident during the film premiere.
newTitle: Hyderabad Court Delays Bail Decision for Allu Arjun in Stampede Case
